definition: senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)

sentences.english: The supernatural and wonderful Wuyi Mountains was called"the sixteenth fairyland"by Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 武夷山钟灵毓秀，被道教尊奉为“第十六小洞天”。

sentences.english: Therefore, he was enshrined in the Chinese sage and teacher for the Tai Shing.
sentences.chinese: 因此他被中华民族尊奉为大成至圣先师。

sentences.english: In clinical practice, confidentiality is always the ethical criterion and conduct for clinicians.
sentences.chinese: 在临床医学中，保密一直是医师们尊奉的圭臬和操守。

sentences.english: This philosophy was good, and stood alone in its time it was our protection.
sentences.chinese: 这种哲学很好，并且为时人所尊奉，它是我们的保护。

sentences.english: The judges also took on record an affidavit submitted by the Union government.
sentences.chinese: 法官也尊奉了联合政府递交的一份宣誓书。

definition: to believe in (a deity or other supernatural being)/to worship
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
first day of the first lunar month/(old) calendar promulgated by the first emperor of a dynasty
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
to imitate/to follow the example of
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
